newsitem.title: USA: Dow claws back from session lows, Nasdaq rises.
newsitem.headline: Dow claws back from session lows, Nasdaq rises.

text.p: U.S. blue chip stocks recouped some of their morning losses on Tuesday while technology stocks tacked on more gains, drawing most of the attention as investors focused on second-quarter earnings.
The Dow Jones Industrial average, which suffered amid some profit-taking earlier in the day, rose from session lows to trade down 12 points at 7911.
The Nasdaq composite extended a recent rally, adding 10 points to 1534. Technology stocks were firmer ahead of results from Intel Corp, due after the close.
The long bond was down 3/32 at a 6.56 percent yield.
